HFB.sentence_name: Trawl Headrope to Footrope and Bottom

field_names: Barometric pressure, inches of mercury, to the nearest 0.01 inch
Barometric pressure, bars, to the nearest .001 bar
Air temperature, degrees C, to the nearest 0.1 degree C
Water temperature, degrees C (this field left blank by WeatherStation)
Relative humidity, percent, to the nearest 0.1 percent
Dew point, degrees C, to the nearest 0.1 degree C
Wind direction, degrees True, to the nearest 0.1 degree
Wind direction, degrees Magnetic, to the nearest 0.1 degree
Wind speed, knots, to the nearest 0.1 knot
Wind speed, meters per second, to the nearest 0.1 m/s
Interval for MSS message status (null for no status), seconds
Status, A = Data Valid, V = Invalid
Status, A = Data Valid, V = Invalid
Rate Of Turn, degrees per minute, "-" means bow turns to port
Status, A means data is valid
Propeller pitch, % of maximum, "-" means astern
Starboard (or single) rudder sensor, "-" means Turn To Port
Cursor Bearing Degrees Clockwise From Zero
Display rotation (C = course up, H = heading up, N - North up)
Total number of RE sentences being transmitted
Sentence mode c = complete route, all waypoints w = working route, the waypoint you just left, the waypoint you’re heading to, then all the rest
Catch sensor #1 (0 = off, 1 = on, 2 = no answer)
Catch sensor #2 (0 = off, 1 = on, 2 = no answer)
Catch sensor #3 (0 = off, 1 = on, 2 = no answer)
Target Latitude, dd is degrees, mm.mm is minutes.
Target Longitude, dd is degrees, mm.mm is minutes.
UTC of data, hh is hours, mm is minutes, ss.ss is seconds.
Horizontal distance from the vessel center line
Horizontal distance from the transducer to the trawl along the vessel center line. The value is normally positive assuming the trawl is located behind the vessel.
Depth of the trawl below the surface
Bearing to target relative to vessel heading. Resolution is one degree.
Depth of trawl below the surface
True bearing to target (ie. relative north). Resolution is one degree.
Depth of trawl below the surface
UTC of fix, hh is hours, mm is minutes, ss.ss is seconds.
Latitude, dd is degrees, mm.mm is minutes.
Longitude, dd is degrees, mm.mm is minutes.
UTC of data (NMEA 3 and above) hh is hours, mm is minutes, ss.ss is seconds.
Type, A = Auto, M = Manual, R = Reported (NMEA 3 and above)
Longitudinal water speed, "-" means astern, knots
Transverse water speed, "-" means port, knots
Longitudinal ground speed, "-" means astern, knots
Transverse ground speed, "-" means port, knots

Stern traverse ground speed, knots *NMEA 3 and above)
Status, stern ground speed A = Valid (NMEA 3 and above)
Speed of vessel relative to the water, knots
Speed of vessel relative to the water, km/hr
Total cumulative ground distance, nm (NMEA 3 and above)
Ground distance since reset, nm (NMEA 3 and above)

field_names: FAA Mode indicator, not null (NMEA 3 and above)

Units of measurement A = Amperes B = Bars B = Binary C = Celsius D = Degrees H = Hertz I = liters/second K = Kelvin K = kg/m3 M = Meters M = cubic Meters N = Newton P = % of full range P = Pascal R = RPM S = Parts per thousand V = Volts
V = Loran-C Blink or SNR warning
V = general warning flag or other navigation systems when a reliable fix is not available
V = Loran-C Cycle Lock warning flag
Direction to steer, L or R
Cross Track Units, N = Nautical Miles
FAA mode indicator (NMEA 2.3 and later, optional)
Direction to steer, L or R
UTC time (hours, minutes, seconds, may have fractional subseconds)
Local zone minutes description, 00 to 59, apply same sign as local hours
Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) hh is hours, mm is minutes, ss.ss is seconds.
